graph.original_query: I want to know the details of features for Mahindra XUV 3XO, use a single step for Retriever Agent but use multiple iterations in a single step to fetch detailed information, In the final iteration of the Retriever Agent combine outputs from current and previous iterations as final step output and then create a report.

T001.initial_thoughts: Breaking down the user's request into multiple specific web search queries to gather comprehensive raw data about the Mahindra XUV 3XO's features, specifications, variants, safety, interior, exterior, performance, and technology. All searches will be executed within a single code block, and their raw results will be collected under distinct keys.

code.CODE_1:
results_features = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO features', 8)
results_specs = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO specifications', 8)
results_variants = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO variants', 8)
results_safety = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO safety features', 8)
results_interior = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO interior details', 8)
results_exterior = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO exterior design', 8)
results_performance = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO performance metrics', 8)
results_technology = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO technology and infotainment', 8)
output = {
  'features': results_features,
  'specifications': results_specs,
  'variants': results_variants,
  'safety_features': results_safety,
  'interior_details': results_interior,
  'exterior_design': results_exterior,
  'performance_metrics': results_performance,
  'technology_infotainment': results_technology
}

Mahindra XUV 3XO Features Explained: A Comprehensive Guide. Published on 27 Aug, 2024, 9:41 AM IST Updated on 28 Aug, 2024, 5:59 AM IST Team Ackodrive 8 min read Interesting Articles Follow us on Share Post Mahindra recently launched the much-awaited Mahindra XUV 3XO as a compact SUV in the Indian automotive industry. Outperforming its rivals, the Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue and Maruti Suzuki Brezza, the Mahindra XUV 3XO brings a fresh look to the segment. With the latest updates and comfortable features, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is on the list of must-buy compact SUVs in India. Here, we will take a closer look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained and help you choose the ideal car. Contents Price of Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants After the Mahindra XUV 3XO features are explained, you must know the price of each variant. Hence, we have prepared a table for you highlighting the ex-showroom price of each XUV 3XO variant: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variant Ex-Showroom Price MX1 Rs. 7.49 Lakhs MX2 Rs. 9.99 Lakhs MX2 PRO Rs. 8.99 Lakhs to Rs. 10.39 Lakhs MX3 Rs. 9.49 Lakhs to Rs. 11.68 Lakhs MX3 PRO Rs. 9.99 Lakhs to Rs. 11.49 Lakhs AX5 Rs. 10.69 Lakhs to Rs. 12.88 Lakhs AX5 Luxury Rs. 11.99 Lakhs to Rs. 13.49 Lakhs AX7 Rs. 12.49 Lakhs to Rs. 14.49 Lakhs AX7 Luxury Rs. 13.99 Lakhs to Rs. 15.49 Lakhs Note : The prices of the Mahindra XUV 3XO variants can change without any prior notice. So, before booking your car, talk with your nearest dealer to know the latest price. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants Unlatch Elated Driving Experience with the All New Mahindra XUV 3XO Making its presence felt in the Indian compact SUV market, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is one of the best cars in this segment manufactured by Mahindra. It offers more convenience and comfort when driving on different terrains. The following are detailed discussions of the Mahindra XUV 3XO tech specs and features: 1. Influencing Exterior Look The Mahindra XUV 3XO has a specific design to turn heads with its athletic stance. It commands respect and exudes the confidence of a true SUV. The all-new Mahindra XUV 3XO has an ample ground clearance of 201 mm, making it easy for you to drive on rocky terrains. In addition, the XUV 3XO comes with a command seating position to offer an exhilarating driving experience. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has LED DRLs and headlamps that will lead the road to envy you whenever you turn them on. Furthermore, the infinity tail lamps add an X factor to your style quotient. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels for that sporty look. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Dimensions 2. Comforting Interior When you drive the Mahindra XUV 3XO, it elevates your every journey. Stepping inside the XUV 3XOs cabin will let you discover a sanctuary of sophistication and comfort. It is one of the key parts of the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained, as it has a meticulous design for the finest SUV lovers. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a Skyroof and soft-touch leatherette on the door trims and dashboard. Furthermore, the car has premium leatherette seats, a cooled glovebox with illumination, and a passive keyless entry. It also features a front armrest with storage and a console with a cup holder for a comfortable drive. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Interior 3. Smart Connectivity Another key Mahindra XUV 3XO configuration is its smart connectivity and technology. The car comes with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system to make your drive enjoyable. In addition, the sound system lets you experience sonic expanse, and the bass enhancer technology uplifts your mood while driving in crowded areas. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation and has built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment. Published On Jul 10, 2025 04:21:00 PM 1,06,164 Views Follow us on By Saptarshi Mondal Share - The Mahindra XUV 3XO , formerly XUV300, was launched last year with all-new front and rear designs, a refreshed interior and more features, as well as new powertrain options. Currently priced from Rs 7.99 lakh to Rs 15.79 lakh, ex-showroom India, this Mahindra SUV is available in a total of 12 trim levels (see table below). In this feature, we take a closer look at what features and engine options you get with each trim. Mahindra XUV 3XO petrol variant prices (in Rs, lakh) Petrol-MT Petrol-AT Diesel-MT Diesel-AMT MX1 7.99 - - - RevX M 8.94 - - - RevX M(O) 9.44 - - - MX2 - - 9.99 - MX2 Pro 9.54 10.54 10.64 - MX3 9.74 11.40 10.99 11.79 MX3 Pro 9.99 11.69 11.56 - AX5 11.19 12.69 12.19 12.99 RevX A T-GDI 11.79 12.99 - - AX5L T-GDI 12.62 13.94 - - AX7 T-GDI 12.80 13.99 13.69 14.70 AX7L T-GDI 13.99 15.80 14.99 - Mahindra XUV 3XO variant-wise powertrains The XUV 3XO's engine options include a 111hp, 200Nm, 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine, 131hp, 230Nm, 1.2-litre TGDI engine and 117hp, 300Nm, and 1.5-litre diesel engine.A 6-speed manual gearbox is standard with these engines.Also, both petrol engines get a 6-speed torque converter automatic gearbox, while the diesel XUV 3XO models come with a 6-speed AMT unit. The 111hp turbo-petrol engine is available on the MX1, RevX M, RevX M(O), MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, MX3 Pro and the AX5 trims. Moving on, the 131hp turbo-petrol engine is available only on the top four trims - RevX A, AX5 L, AX7 and AX7 L. The diesel engine is available nearly across the board, starting from the fourth-from-base MX2 trim. Here's a look at the variant split of the new XUV 3XO. one diesel engine option. The entry-level XUV 3XO gets a 1.2-liter turbo MPFI petrol engine while the higher variants come with a 1.2-liter turbo direct injection petrol. Additionally, there is a 1.5-liter diesel engine on offer on the XUV 3XO as well. Mahindra XUV 3XO on road price starts from Rs 8.50 lakh going upto Rs 17.84 lakh for the top model diesel automatic variant. The more powerful petrol engine on offer on the XUV 3XO is the 1.2 TGDI version that churns out a healthy 130hp and 230Nm. It can be opted with either a six-speed manual or a six-speed automatic. Mahindra XUV 3XO mileage for the 1.2 TGDI petrol ranges from 20.1kpl for the manual and 18.2kpl for the automatic. This engine is available on the XUV 3XO AX5 L, the AX7 and the AX7 L variants. 5-star Bharat NCAP Safety Rating Compact SUV of the Year: Autocar Awards 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO key specifications The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a choice of three engines: 1.2L turbo petrol with 110 PS, 1.2L TGDi turbo petrol with 130 PS, and 1.5L diesel with 117 PS, paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. It features a spacious 385-litre boot, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and a panoramic sunroof which is the widest in the segment. With over 60 connected car features and Level 2 ADAS, it is a tech-loaded compact SUV. Pune Hyderabad Ahmedabad Chennai Kolkata Home Features Mahindra XUV 3XO price, variants, features explained Mahindra XUV 3XO price, variants, features explained The XUV 3XO recently added new RevX variants, which are offered with two turbo-petrol engine options. Published On Jul 10, 2025 04:21:00 PM 1,06,165 Views Follow us on By Saptarshi Mondal Share - The Mahindra XUV 3XO , formerly XUV300, was launched last year with all-new front and rear designs, a refreshed interior and more features, as well as new powertrain options. Currently priced from Rs 7.99 lakh to Rs 15.79 lakh, ex-showroom India, this Mahindra SUV is available in a total of 12 trim levels (see table below). In this feature, we take a closer look at what features and engine options you get with each trim. Mahindra XUV 3XO petrol variant prices (in Rs, lakh) Petrol-MT Petrol-AT Diesel-MT Diesel-AMT MX1 7.99 - - - RevX M 8.94 - - - RevX M(O) 9.44 - - - MX2 - - 9.99 - MX2 Pro 9.54 10.54 10.64 - MX3 9.74 11.40 10.99 11.79 MX3 Pro 9.99 11.69 11.56 - AX5 11.19 12.69 12.19 12.99 RevX A T-GDI 11.79 12.99 - - AX5L T-GDI 12.62 13.94 - - AX7 T-GDI 12.80 13.99 13.69 14.70 AX7L T-GDI 13.99 15.80 14.99 - Mahindra XUV 3XO variant-wise powertrains The XUV 3XO's engine options include a 111hp, 200Nm, 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine, 131hp, 230Nm, 1.2-litre TGDI engine and 117hp, 300Nm, and 1.5-litre diesel engine.A 6-speed manual gearbox is standard with these engines.Also, both petrol engines get a 6-speed torque converter automatic gearbox, while the diesel XUV 3XO models come with a 6-speed AMT unit. The 111hp turbo-petrol engine is available on the MX1, RevX M, RevX M(O), MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, MX3 Pro and the AX5 trims. Moving on, the 131hp turbo-petrol engine is available only on the top four trims - RevX A, AX5 L, AX7 and AX7 L. The diesel engine is available nearly across the board, starting from the fourth-from-base MX2 trim. Here's a look at the variant split of the new XUV 3XO. Mahindra XUV 3XO Features Explained: A Comprehensive Guide. Published on 27 Aug, 2024, 9:41 AM IST Updated on 28 Aug, 2024, 5:59 AM IST Team Ackodrive 8 min read Interesting Articles Follow us on Share Post Mahindra recently launched the much-awaited Mahindra XUV 3XO as a compact SUV in the Indian automotive industry. Outperforming its rivals, the Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue and Maruti Suzuki Brezza, the Mahindra XUV 3XO brings a fresh look to the segment. With the latest updates and comfortable features, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is on the list of must-buy compact SUVs in India. Here, we will take a closer look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained and help you choose the ideal car. Contents Price of Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants After the Mahindra XUV 3XO features are explained, you must know the price of each variant. Hence, we have prepared a table for you highlighting the ex-showroom price of each XUV 3XO variant: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variant Ex-Showroom Price MX1 Rs. 7.49 Lakhs MX2 Rs. 9.99 Lakhs MX2 PRO Rs. 8.99 Lakhs to Rs. 10.39 Lakhs MX3 Rs. 9.49 Lakhs to Rs. 11.68 Lakhs MX3 PRO Rs. 9.99 Lakhs to Rs. 11.49 Lakhs AX5 Rs. 10.69 Lakhs to Rs. 12.88 Lakhs AX5 Luxury Rs. 11.99 Lakhs to Rs. 13.49 Lakhs AX7 Rs. 12.49 Lakhs to Rs. 14.49 Lakhs AX7 Luxury Rs. 13.99 Lakhs to Rs. 15.49 Lakhs Note : The prices of the Mahindra XUV 3XO variants can change without any prior notice. So, before booking your car, talk with your nearest dealer to know the latest price. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants Unlatch Elated Driving Experience with the All New Mahindra XUV 3XO Making its presence felt in the Indian compact SUV market, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is one of the best cars in this segment manufactured by Mahindra. It offers more convenience and comfort when driving on different terrains. The following are detailed discussions of the Mahindra XUV 3XO tech specs and features: 1. Influencing Exterior Look The Mahindra XUV 3XO has a specific design to turn heads with its athletic stance. It commands respect and exudes the confidence of a true SUV. The all-new Mahindra XUV 3XO has an ample ground clearance of 201 mm, making it easy for you to drive on rocky terrains. In addition, the XUV 3XO comes with a command seating position to offer an exhilarating driving experience. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has LED DRLs and headlamps that will lead the road to envy you whenever you turn them on. Furthermore, the infinity tail lamps add an X factor to your style quotient. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels for that sporty look. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Dimensions 2. Comforting Interior When you drive the Mahindra XUV 3XO, it elevates your every journey. Stepping inside the XUV 3XOs cabin will let you discover a sanctuary of sophistication and comfort. It is one of the key parts of the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained, as it has a meticulous design for the finest SUV lovers. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a Skyroof and soft-touch leatherette on the door trims and dashboard. Furthermore, the car has premium leatherette seats, a cooled glovebox with illumination, and a passive keyless entry. It also features a front armrest with storage and a console with a cup holder for a comfortable drive. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Interior 3. Smart Connectivity Another key Mahindra XUV 3XO configuration is its smart connectivity and technology. The car comes with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system to make your drive enjoyable. In addition, the sound system lets you experience sonic expanse, and the bass enhancer technology uplifts your mood while driving in crowded areas. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation and has built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment. Team Spinny Last updated 3 months ago As we all know the safety of a vehicle is one of the most important attributes in current times. People want a car that not only delivers on performance and efficiency but also stands out with its safety features. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is making headlines as one of the safest small SUVs in India. This beast by Mahindra has gained attention for its advanced features and design, which are further complemented with its safety features. It is an upgraded version of the Mahindra XUV300 that packs a strong punch. The starting price of the Mahindra XUV 3XO is Rs. 7.99 lakh (ex-showroom), making it an affordable yet well-equipped compact SUV. The safety of a vehicle is best measured through crash test ratings, and Mahindra has ensured that the XUV 3XO meets high standards. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating proves that it is one of the safest cars in its segment. Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP Safety Rating Checking a cars NCAP rating is one of the best ways to understand how safe it is. NCAP, or the New Car Assessment Program, conducts crash tests to see how well a vehicle can protect its occupants in an accident. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has performed well in its NCAP tests. It was tested under Bharat NCAP (BNCAP), which is Indias version of the global safety program. The Mahindra XUV 3XO received a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP, meaning it provides excellent protection for both adults and children. Lets look at the details of the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP rating. Mahindra XUV 3XO Adult Occupant Protection Rating During the adult occupants rating in the NCAP test, the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP ratings were pretty impressive. The vehicle scored the maximum possible score of 29.36 out of 32 points . Some crucial factors that contributed to this high rating include: Stable Bodyshell: The structure of the Mahindra XUV 3XO has been found to be stable, meaning it can withstand additional impact without collapsing. Frontal Impact Protection: The cars front airbags and seatbelt pre-tensioners helped reduce injuries to the head, neck, and chest. Side Impact Protection: The side structure of the XUV 3XO, along with additional side and curtain airbags, ensured safety in side collisions. Electronic Stability Control (ESC): This system helps maintain control of the car during sudden turns or slippery conditions, reducing the chances of rollovers. All-Wheel Disc Brakes: The XUV 3XO offers disc brakes on all four wheels, providing better braking efficiency. Mahindra XUV 3XO Child Occupant Protection Rating Child safety is another critical aspect of a cars overall safety rating. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating for child occupants is 43 out of 49 points , which is an excellent score. This means the car provides solid protection for children in case of an accident. Some of the key factors that contributed to this rating include: ISOFIX Child Seat Anchors: These allow parents to securely install child safety seats, reducing the risk of movement in case of impact. Dual-tone exterior colours are standard. 5 exterior colour options available. 16-inch black alloys of REVX A; RevX M variants get 16-inch steel wheels with black covers. RevX badge seen on C-pillar. RevX A gets the 131hp engine and an automatic gearbox option. RevX variants' interior layout the same as standard XUV 3XO. RevX M gets driver's seat height adjust over the MX2 Pro. Black leatherette seats standard on all RevX variants. RevX M gets 4-speaers; REVX A gets 6 speakers. 10.25-inch infotainment touchscreen standard on RevX variants. Loans XUV3XOInsurance Mahindra XUV 3XO: All Details You Need To Know In 10 Images Apr 29, 2024 | Views: 8242 | 3 min read By Yashein Kewalramani The XUV 3XO gets a fresher design and a modernised cabin featuring a segment-first panoramic sunroof Mahindra has launched the awaited XUV 3XO , basically the facelifted XUV300, at Rs 7.49 lakh (ex-showroom). The subcompact SUV sports a new modern design, an upgraded cabin which is similar to that of the XUV400 EV, plentiful new features and even mechanical updates. In this report, we are going to take you through the gallery of the XUV 3XO showcasing the design, interior, features and its specifications: Design The Mahindra 3XO gets a revamped design for the exterior, with a new fascia featuring a new bumper and a gloss black grille with chrome slats replacing the slatted one found in the XUX300. Flanking the grille, is a new pair of redesigned LED headlights, which adds to the overall modern appearance of the XUV 3XO. It now gets 17-inch dual-tone alloy wheels and apart from that, there are no other sheet metal changes here. You get to choose from 8 colour options: white, red, orange, beige, black, grey, green and yellow. Coming to the rear, it gets a new tailgate with connected LED taillights making it the first Mahindra to get a connected setup. Placed right below the taillights is the new XUV 3XO badge. It also gets a silver skid plate adding a bit of contrast and the number plate housing is in the bumper. With the new elements and styling, the subcompact SUV looks modern with a dash of ruggedness. Interior And Features Step inside and you will notice a new dashboard layout and cabin design, similar to that of the XUV4OO EV. The first thing you will notice is the 10.25-inch floating touchscreen infotainment system, below which are the AC vents located right above the chunky looking controls for the dual-zone climate control. It retains the same steering wheel which the pre-facelift XUV300 got, but with gloss-black inserts instead of the silver finish. Further enhancing the cabins feel is a segment-first panoramic sunroof which adds to the SUVs value proposition. The upgraded cabin gets a host of new features which make the SUV more desirable than before. The features include a 10.25-inch infotainment screen with wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay, 7-speaker Harman/Kardon sound system, connected car tech, 10.25-inch drivers display, dual-zone climate control, keyless entry, push-button start/stop, and wireless phone charging. Safety will be taken care of by Level-2 ADAS (first in its segment), 6 airbags, ABS, EBD, 360-degree camera, electronic stability control, 3-point seatbelts with reminder for all occupants, and ISOFIX child seat mounts. Specifications The XUV 3XO gets the same engines carried over from the XUV300. The engine options include a 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine generating 110 PS, a 1.2-litre T-GDI turbo-petrol engine producing 130 PS, and a 1.5-litre diesel engine making 117 PS. You get an option to pair these engines with either a manual or an automatic gearbox. The manual will be a 6-speed unit, while the automatic option will be a 6-speed torque converter for the petrol variants and an 6-speed AMT gearbox for the diesel variants. Price and rivals The XUV 3XO is priced from Rs 7.49 lakh to Rs 15.49 lakh (ex-showroom). With the introduction of the new XUV 3XO , Mahindra will look to give a tougher fight to the likes of Hyundai Venue , Kia Sonet , Tata Nexon and Maruti Suzuki Brezza . If you are interested in the fully-loaded REVX A trim of the sub-4m SUV, heres a detailed look at it in 10 real-life images. Front The Mahindra XUV 3XO REVX A comes with a similar design as the regular model, albeit with a few changes. The grille is now body coloured and features the same chrome slats as the regular XUV 3XO. It gets the same projector LED headlights with surrounding LED DRLs like a scorpions sting. The lower portion of the bumper continues with a blacked out portion with some curvy design elements. It comes in 5 colour options, which are: Everest White Galaxy Grey Nebula Blue Stealth Black Tango Red Notably, the Stealth Black colour gets a grey grille while the other hues get a body-coloured finish. Side In profile, it comes with 16-inch black alloy wheels that make the new variant look sportier than the regular trims. To distinguish it further, Mahindra has added a REVX badge on the C-pillar. That said, it continues with black body cladding on the wheel arches and doors. The roof, roof rails and A-, B-, and C-pillar are finished in black too to gel along with the overall theme. Rear At the rear, it gets the same connected LED tail lights and a black bumper with reflectors and silver skid plate. Whats different is that the new variant gets a REVX badge on the right side of the tailgate. Interior Both the standard and REVX variants of the XUV 3XO comes with the same black / white dashboard. That said, t he white leatherette seat upholstery of the regular variants have been changed to black in the REVX variants. Other than this, everything else including the dashboard design, the dual 10.25-inch screens and 3-spoke steering wheel is identical to the already available trims. Features And Safety The Mahindra XUV 3XO REVX A slots above the AX5 trim and gets a lot of features over the regular variant. As mentioned above, it gets dual 10.25-inch screens (one for the infotainment and another for the drivers display). It is also the most affordable variant in the sub-4m SUVs lineup to get a panoramic sunroof. Other features include dual-zone auto AC with rear vents, a wireless phone charger and a 6-speaker sound system. As the latest addition to Mahindras popular XUV range, the XUV 3XO combines style, comfort, performance, safety, and technology. In this detailed blog post, we will explore the key exterior and interior design elements of the XUV 3XO and how Mahindra has crafted an SUV that makes a strong visual impact. An Exterior that Demands Attention One look at the new XUV 3XO is all it takes to notice how dramatically styled this SUV is. The front, sides and rear reflect a sense of dynamism that appeals to young and young-at-heart buyers. Some of the standout exterior highlights include: A Bold & Distinctive Face The XUV 3XOs front fascia features a wide, imposing grille with distinct chrome inserts and the signature Mahindra twin peaks logo. This immediately gives it a bold SUV character. The grille seamlessly integrates with the slim headlamps that extend towards the wheel arches, giving a frowning look. The eye-shaped bi-LED projector headlamps with integrated LED daytime running lamps are added to the dramatic front styling. With chrome bezels, these headlamps have a high-tech look and also deliver powerful illumination. Further amping up the visual drama are niceties like the skid plate with silver accents dominating the lower bumper. The round fog lamps integrated into the skid plate amplify the front presence. Sculpted Profile Exuding Power In profile, the XUV 3XO maintains a muscular and athletic form. The flared wheel arches with cladding grab attention, while the pronounced shoulder line adds to the sculpted appeal. The 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels fill up the arches well, while the raised stance lends the XUV 3XO a towering road presence. Body-coloured ORVMs blend neatly into the design. Customers can also opt for a contrast roof and ORVM colours for a bi-tone effect. The window line rises dynamically towards the rear, while the rear haunch is well-defined. Subtle creases on the lower portion of doors make the silhouette more intriguing. Sleek & Modern Rear Profile The rear of the XUV 3XO continues to surprise with its contemporary design. It features a pair of LED tail lamps that extend onto the tailgate and have a three-dimensional effect. These graphic-rich tail lamps also incorporate neat LED turn signals. The tailgate has clean surfacing, while the chrome applique and model badging add premium touches. Adding some muscle are the dual exhaust pipes integrated into the black rear skid plate. The roof-mounted spoiler with an integrated high-mount stop lamp rounds off the rear nicely. A Cabin Exuding Warmth & Luxury Stepping inside the XUV 3XO gives you the same feeling as entering a plush lounge. The cabin prioritises comfort without compromising on the premium quotient. Some talking points of the well-appointed interior include: Premium Styling & Materials The XUV 3XO greets occupants with a classy dual-tone cabin featuring a black & beige colour theme. Premium leatherette door trims with stitching details instantly catch the eye. The leatherette seats come in the same colour scheme, feel supple, and provide snug support. Ambient lighting elevates the cabins sense of occasion, especially for night travel. Ergonomic & Functional Layout Despite modern styling and premium materials, the XUV 3XO retains Mahindras focus on practicality & ease of use. Controls fall easily at hand, while the uncluttered centre console offers storage solutions like a cooled glove box. The infotainment system with Apple CarPlay & Android Auto is in prime position. performance_metrics.text: [{'url': 'https://www.overdrive.in/news-cars-auto/mahindra-xuv-3xo-tgdi-at-real-world-mileage-and-performance-figures-revealed/', 'content': "Mahindra XUV 3XO TGDI AT real world mileage and performance figures revealed - Overdrive CARS Find Cars Compare Cars Car Reviews Car Photos Car Videos Car Brands Just Launched Cars Upcoming Cars Popular Cars Bikes Find Bikes Compare Bikes Bike Reviews Bike Photos Bike Videos Bike Brands Just Launched Bikes Upcoming Bikes Popular Bikes Reviews All Reviews Car Reviews Bike Reviews First Drive Road Test Comparo News & Features News Features Opinions Motorsport Press Releases photos All Photos Car Photos Bike Photos Videos compare Compare Cars Compare Bikes SUBSCRIBE | APP get app Subscribe Trending: Jeep Compass 4x2 AT Tata Nexon EV Citroen C3 Aircross TVS Apache RTR 310 RE Bullet 350 Honda CB200X Follow us Cars Bikes news reviews compare Advertisement Type vehicle name.. go Home News Mahindra XUV 3XO TGDI AT real world mileage and performance figures revealed Gajanan Kashikar Updated: May 10, 2024, 05:37 PM IST Mahindra recently launched the new XUV 3XO with prices starting from Rs 7.49 lakh (ex-showroom). It is available in a range of variants, namely MX1 Pro, MX2 Pro, MX3, AX5, AX5L, AX7, and AX7L. We recently tested the updated XUV 3XO to get the real-world performance and mileage figures, read on to find out the details. Mahindra XUV 3XO: Powertrain While the XUV 3XO carries over the same 110PS/200Nm 1.2-litre turbo-petrol, a 130PS/230Nm 1.2-litre T-GDI turbo-petrol, and a 117PS/300Nm 1.5-litre diesel engine, there is a new six-speed torque converter automatic transmission on offer alongside a six-speed manual and a six-speed AMT. In our performance test, the 1.2-litre TGDI petrol with six-speed automatic transmission returned a mileage of 12.49kmpl in the city and 14.87kmpl on the highway. In contrast, the overall ARAI fuel economy of this powertrain stands at 18.20kmpl. Further, the 1.2-litre turbocharged petrol paired with the six-speed torque convertor enabled the XUV 3XO to achieve zero to 100kmph in 10.7 seconds. In terms of in-gear acceleration, the SUV was able to reach from 30kmph to 50kmph in 2.0 seconds, 50kmph to 70kmph in 2.3 seconds, and 60kmph to 80kmph in 2.8 seconds. In addition, a braking test was conducted, revealing that the XUV 3XO required 3.7 seconds to come to a complete stop from a speed of 100kmph, covering a distance of 46m. Performance, and Safety  | Cargraze Home Cars Car Blog Tools Loan EMI Calculator Mileage Calculator Sell Used Car Check RC Login/ Register Home Car Info 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO: Specs, Design, Performance, and Safety 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO: Specs, Design, Performance, and Safety Published On Dec 24, 2024 By Cargraze for Car Info A Comprehensive Review of the Mahindra XUV 3XO in 2025: Features, Performance, and Value Are you looking for a compact yet powerful vehicle that combines performance, safety, and value in one stunning package? The Mahindra XUV 3XO might be the car youre searching for! Lets dive into a detailed review to see what this model brings in 2025. Design and Exterior Highlights One look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO, especially in black, and its clear that this car is a head-turner. Its sporty design elements stand out with: Chrome Accents: The grille and headlamp finish feature stylish chrome highlights. Projector Headlamps with LED DRLs: These enhance visibility and aesthetics. Diamond-Cut Alloy Wheels: The 16-inch alloys add a premium feel to the vehicle. Safety Ratings: With six airbags and a five-star Global NCAP safety rating, this vehicle excels in safety. Roof Rails & Spoilers: Gloss-black roof rails and a sleek spoiler give it a bold presence on the road. Although the car lacks front parking sensors and certain accessories come as add-ons, its robust styling and road presence more than makes up for these minor drawbacks. Interior Comfort and Technology Step inside the Mahindra XUV 3XO, and youll be greeted by a modern and comfortable cabin: Dual-Tone Dashboard: Soft-touch materials on the doors and satin finishes on the levers add a premium touch. Advanced Infotainment System: A 10.25-inch infotainment display paired with a 10.25-inch digital instrument cluster ensures seamless access to information and entertainment. Steering Controls: A three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel includes controls for cruise and infotainment systems. Comfort Features: From automatic climate control with dual-zone functionality to wireless charging and a vanity mirror with illumination, convenience is a priority. While its disappointing that the glovebox isnt cooled or illuminated, the XUV 3XO compensates with thoughtful features like rear AC vents, adjustable headrests, and ample storage options. Performance and Engine Specifications Under the hood, the Mahindra XUV 3XO packs a punch with its turbocharged petrol engine: Engine Options: It comes with a 1.2-liter three-cylinder MPFI engine, delivering 109 BHP and 200 Nm of torque. Transmission: Choose between manual and automatic transmissions, depending on your driving preference. Fuel Efficiency: Mahindra claims an ARAI-certified mileage of 18.5 km/l, though real-world figures hover around 14-15 km/l. The cars ride quality, stability, and safety features like ABS with EBD, electronic stability control, and tyre pressure monitoring ensure a secure driving experience. Practicality and Storage With a 364-liter boot space, the XUV 3XO offers decent storage capacity. However, operating the boot can feel a bit cumbersome due to its electromagnetic button placement. The spare wheel, tool kit, and first-aid essentials are neatly arranged but require some effort to access. Final Thoughts The Mahindra XUV 3XO is an impressive contender in the compact SUV segment. While it has its minor quirks, the blend of safety, design, and performance makes it a strong value-for-money option in its price range. Would we recommend it? Absolutely! Add it to your shortlist and take it for a spin to see if its the perfect fit for your needs. Dont forget to share your thoughts on this versatile vehicle in the comments section! Published On Apr 24, 2024 04:02:00 PM 79,590 Views Follow us on By Sahil Kukreja Share - Listen to this Article Your browser does not support the audio element. Mahindra has released yet another teaser of the XUV300 facelift to be called XUV 3XO just days ahead of its global debut. The new teaser video reveals its fuel efficiency figure as well as its 0-60kph sprint time. XUV 3XO diesel likely to deliver 20.1kpl XUV 3XO 1.2-litre TGDi likely to do 0-60kph in 4.5 seconds Launch on April 29 Also see: Mahindra XUV 3XO interior revealed in new teaser Mahindra XUV 3XO: performance, fuel efficiency As per the latest teaser, the XUV 3XO will be able to dash from 0-60kph in 4.5 seconds. However, well only be able to confirm the number once we get to drive it following the global debut. For reference, our Venue vs Sonet road test revealed that the 120hp 1.2-litre turbo-petrol-DCTversions of the two achieve the same feat in 5.30 seconds and 5.87 seconds respectively. Furthermore, the teaser confirms that the updated compact SUV will offer multiple drive modes, similar to the XUV700. While the larger SUV gets three drive modes namely Zip, Zap and Zoom the teaser suggests that the XUV 3XO could get the former two. Mahindra has also revealed that the XUV 3XO will offer an ARAI-certified fuel efficiency figure of 20.1kpl, however, the figure will likely be for the diesel powertrain, not the turbo-petrol engines. In comparison, the Tata Nexon diesel as a fuel efficiency of up to 24.07kpl , while the Kia Sonetdiesel with iMT is rated at 22.3kpl . That said, the XUV 3XO will continue with the same three engine options the 110hp, 1.2-litre turbo-petrol; the 131hp, 1.2-litre direct-injection turbo-petrol; and the 117hp, 1.5-litre diesel. The 131hp turbo-petrol engine will gain a new Aisin-sourced 6-speed torque converter automatic transmission. Mahindra XUV 3XO: feature upgrade, price, rivals The new XUV 3XO teaser reveals its fully-digital TFT instrument cluster in all its glory. The drivers display will measure 10.25-inches in size, while the car will also borrow the XUV400s 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system. Also on offer will be a first-in-class panoramic sunroof, which will possibly make it the most affordable SUV in India with this feature. Keeping in mind all the changes and the additional features , the XUV 3XO will be priced higher than the outgoing XUV300 . It will continue to take on the likes of Hyundai Venue , Tata Nexon , Kia Sonet , Maruti Brezza among other compact SUVs. Mahindra XUV 3XO Features Explained: A Comprehensive Guide. Published on 27 Aug, 2024, 9:41 AM IST Updated on 28 Aug, 2024, 5:59 AM IST Team Ackodrive 8 min read Interesting Articles Follow us on Share Post Mahindra recently launched the much-awaited Mahindra XUV 3XO as a compact SUV in the Indian automotive industry. Outperforming its rivals, the Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue and Maruti Suzuki Brezza, the Mahindra XUV 3XO brings a fresh look to the segment. With the latest updates and comfortable features, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is on the list of must-buy compact SUVs in India. Here, we will take a closer look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained and help you choose the ideal car. Contents Price of Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants After the Mahindra XUV 3XO features are explained, you must know the price of each variant. Hence, we have prepared a table for you highlighting the ex-showroom price of each XUV 3XO variant: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variant Ex-Showroom Price MX1 Rs. 7.49 Lakhs MX2 Rs. 9.99 Lakhs MX2 PRO Rs. 8.99 Lakhs to Rs. 10.39 Lakhs MX3 Rs. 9.49 Lakhs to Rs. 11.68 Lakhs MX3 PRO Rs. 9.99 Lakhs to Rs. 11.49 Lakhs AX5 Rs. 10.69 Lakhs to Rs. 12.88 Lakhs AX5 Luxury Rs. 11.99 Lakhs to Rs. 13.49 Lakhs AX7 Rs. 12.49 Lakhs to Rs. 14.49 Lakhs AX7 Luxury Rs. 13.99 Lakhs to Rs. 15.49 Lakhs Note : The prices of the Mahindra XUV 3XO variants can change without any prior notice. So, before booking your car, talk with your nearest dealer to know the latest price. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants Unlatch Elated Driving Experience with the All New Mahindra XUV 3XO Making its presence felt in the Indian compact SUV market, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is one of the best cars in this segment manufactured by Mahindra. It offers more convenience and comfort when driving on different terrains. The following are detailed discussions of the Mahindra XUV 3XO tech specs and features: 1. Influencing Exterior Look The Mahindra XUV 3XO has a specific design to turn heads with its athletic stance. It commands respect and exudes the confidence of a true SUV. The all-new Mahindra XUV 3XO has an ample ground clearance of 201 mm, making it easy for you to drive on rocky terrains. In addition, the XUV 3XO comes with a command seating position to offer an exhilarating driving experience. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has LED DRLs and headlamps that will lead the road to envy you whenever you turn them on. Furthermore, the infinity tail lamps add an X factor to your style quotient. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels for that sporty look. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Dimensions 2. Comforting Interior When you drive the Mahindra XUV 3XO, it elevates your every journey. Stepping inside the XUV 3XOs cabin will let you discover a sanctuary of sophistication and comfort. It is one of the key parts of the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained, as it has a meticulous design for the finest SUV lovers. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a Skyroof and soft-touch leatherette on the door trims and dashboard. Furthermore, the car has premium leatherette seats, a cooled glovebox with illumination, and a passive keyless entry. It also features a front armrest with storage and a console with a cup holder for a comfortable drive. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Interior 3. Smart Connectivity Another key Mahindra XUV 3XO configuration is its smart connectivity and technology. The car comes with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system to make your drive enjoyable. In addition, the sound system lets you experience sonic expanse, and the bass enhancer technology uplifts your mood while driving in crowded areas. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation and has built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment. nodes.description: Exhaustively research and compile detailed feature specifications, variants, safety features, interior and exterior design elements, performance metrics, and technology integrations of the Mahindra XUV 3XO. The RetrieverAgent will conduct multiple internal search iterations to ensure comprehensive data collection and then consolidate all findings into a single, structured output for subsequent reporting.
nodes.agent_prompt: Perform an exhaustive, multi-iterative web search for 'Mahindra XUV 3XO features', 'Mahindra XUV 3XO specifications', 'Mahindra XUV 3XO variants', 'Mahindra XUV 3XO safety features', 'Mahindra XUV 3XO interior details', 'Mahindra XUV 3XO exterior design', 'Mahindra XUV 3XO performance metrics', and 'Mahindra XUV 3XO technology and infotainment'. For each search, thoroughly extract all relevant details from reputable automotive sources. After completing all iterations, consolidate all gathered information into a comprehensive, structured JSON or Markdown format, ensuring no redundancy and maximal detail. The output should cover all aspects from design to performance, safety, and technology, organized logically for easy consumption.

output.initial_thoughts: Breaking down the user's request into multiple specific web search queries to gather comprehensive raw data about the Mahindra XUV 3XO's features, specifications, variants, safety, interior, exterior, performance, and technology. All searches will be executed within a single code block, and their raw results will be collected under distinct keys.

code.CODE_1:
results_features = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO features', 8)
results_specs = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO specifications', 8)
results_variants = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO variants', 8)
results_safety = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO safety features', 8)
results_interior = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO interior details', 8)
results_exterior = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO exterior design', 8)
results_performance = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO performance metrics', 8)
results_technology = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO technology and infotainment', 8)
output = {
  'features': results_features,
  'specifications': results_specs,
  'variants': results_variants,
  'safety_features': results_safety,
  'interior_details': results_interior,
  'exterior_design': results_exterior,
  'performance_metrics': results_performance,
  'technology_infotainment': results_technology

Mahindra XUV 3XO Features Explained: A Comprehensive Guide. Published on 27 Aug, 2024, 9:41 AM IST Updated on 28 Aug, 2024, 5:59 AM IST Team Ackodrive 8 min read Interesting Articles Follow us on Share Post Mahindra recently launched the much-awaited Mahindra XUV 3XO as a compact SUV in the Indian automotive industry. Outperforming its rivals, the Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue and Maruti Suzuki Brezza, the Mahindra XUV 3XO brings a fresh look to the segment. With the latest updates and comfortable features, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is on the list of must-buy compact SUVs in India. Here, we will take a closer look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained and help you choose the ideal car. Contents Price of Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants After the Mahindra XUV 3XO features are explained, you must know the price of each variant. Hence, we have prepared a table for you highlighting the ex-showroom price of each XUV 3XO variant: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variant Ex-Showroom Price MX1 Rs. 7.49 Lakhs MX2 Rs. 9.99 Lakhs MX2 PRO Rs. 8.99 Lakhs to Rs. 10.39 Lakhs MX3 Rs. 9.49 Lakhs to Rs. 11.68 Lakhs MX3 PRO Rs. 9.99 Lakhs to Rs. 11.49 Lakhs AX5 Rs. 10.69 Lakhs to Rs. 12.88 Lakhs AX5 Luxury Rs. 11.99 Lakhs to Rs. 13.49 Lakhs AX7 Rs. 12.49 Lakhs to Rs. 14.49 Lakhs AX7 Luxury Rs. 13.99 Lakhs to Rs. 15.49 Lakhs Note : The prices of the Mahindra XUV 3XO variants can change without any prior notice. So, before booking your car, talk with your nearest dealer to know the latest price. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants Unlatch Elated Driving Experience with the All New Mahindra XUV 3XO Making its presence felt in the Indian compact SUV market, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is one of the best cars in this segment manufactured by Mahindra. It offers more convenience and comfort when driving on different terrains. The following are detailed discussions of the Mahindra XUV 3XO tech specs and features: 1. Influencing Exterior Look The Mahindra XUV 3XO has a specific design to turn heads with its athletic stance. It commands respect and exudes the confidence of a true SUV. The all-new Mahindra XUV 3XO has an ample ground clearance of 201 mm, making it easy for you to drive on rocky terrains. In addition, the XUV 3XO comes with a command seating position to offer an exhilarating driving experience. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has LED DRLs and headlamps that will lead the road to envy you whenever you turn them on. Furthermore, the infinity tail lamps add an X factor to your style quotient. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels for that sporty look. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Dimensions 2. Comforting Interior When you drive the Mahindra XUV 3XO, it elevates your every journey. Stepping inside the XUV 3XOs cabin will let you discover a sanctuary of sophistication and comfort. It is one of the key parts of the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained, as it has a meticulous design for the finest SUV lovers. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a Skyroof and soft-touch leatherette on the door trims and dashboard. Furthermore, the car has premium leatherette seats, a cooled glovebox with illumination, and a passive keyless entry. It also features a front armrest with storage and a console with a cup holder for a comfortable drive. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Interior 3. Smart Connectivity Another key Mahindra XUV 3XO configuration is its smart connectivity and technology. The car comes with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system to make your drive enjoyable. In addition, the sound system lets you experience sonic expanse, and the bass enhancer technology uplifts your mood while driving in crowded areas. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation and has built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment. Published On Jul 10, 2025 04:21:00 PM 1,06,164 Views Follow us on By Saptarshi Mondal Share - The Mahindra XUV 3XO , formerly XUV300, was launched last year with all-new front and rear designs, a refreshed interior and more features, as well as new powertrain options. Currently priced from Rs 7.99 lakh to Rs 15.79 lakh, ex-showroom India, this Mahindra SUV is available in a total of 12 trim levels (see table below). In this feature, we take a closer look at what features and engine options you get with each trim. Mahindra XUV 3XO petrol variant prices (in Rs, lakh) Petrol-MT Petrol-AT Diesel-MT Diesel-AMT MX1 7.99 - - - RevX M 8.94 - - - RevX M(O) 9.44 - - - MX2 - - 9.99 - MX2 Pro 9.54 10.54 10.64 - MX3 9.74 11.40 10.99 11.79 MX3 Pro 9.99 11.69 11.56 - AX5 11.19 12.69 12.19 12.99 RevX A T-GDI 11.79 12.99 - - AX5L T-GDI 12.62 13.94 - - AX7 T-GDI 12.80 13.99 13.69 14.70 AX7L T-GDI 13.99 15.80 14.99 - Mahindra XUV 3XO variant-wise powertrains The XUV 3XO's engine options include a 111hp, 200Nm, 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine, 131hp, 230Nm, 1.2-litre TGDI engine and 117hp, 300Nm, and 1.5-litre diesel engine.A 6-speed manual gearbox is standard with these engines.Also, both petrol engines get a 6-speed torque converter automatic gearbox, while the diesel XUV 3XO models come with a 6-speed AMT unit. The 111hp turbo-petrol engine is available on the MX1, RevX M, RevX M(O), MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, MX3 Pro and the AX5 trims. Moving on, the 131hp turbo-petrol engine is available only on the top four trims - RevX A, AX5 L, AX7 and AX7 L. The diesel engine is available nearly across the board, starting from the fourth-from-base MX2 trim. Here's a look at the variant split of the new XUV 3XO. specifications Autocar score 8 9.06 - 18.40 Lakh On road price, Delhi Delhi Starting 13,193 /month EMI calculator Get EMI offers Enquire now Mahindra XUV 3XO highlights The XUV 3XO gets two petrol and one diesel engine option. The entry-level XUV 3XO gets a 1.2-liter turbo MPFI petrol engine while the higher variants come with a 1.2-liter turbo direct injection petrol. Additionally, there is a 1.5-liter diesel engine on offer on the XUV 3XO as well. Mahindra XUV 3XO on road price starts from Rs 8.50 lakh going upto Rs 17.84 lakh for the top model diesel automatic variant. The more powerful petrol engine on offer on the XUV 3XO is the 1.2 TGDI version that churns out a healthy 130hp and 230Nm. It can be opted with either a six-speed manual or a six-speed automatic. Mahindra XUV 3XO mileage for the 1.2 TGDI petrol ranges from 20.1kpl for the manual and 18.2kpl for the automatic. This engine is available on the XUV 3XO AX5 L, the AX7 and the AX7 L variants. 5-star Bharat NCAP Safety Rating Compact SUV of the Year: Autocar Awards 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO key specifications The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a choice of three engines: 1.2L turbo petrol with 110 PS, 1.2L TGDi turbo petrol with 130 PS, and 1.5L diesel with 117 PS, paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. It features a spacious 385-litre boot, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and a panoramic sunroof which is the widest in the segment. With over 60 connected car features and Level 2 ADAS, it is a tech-loaded compact SUV. Pune Hyderabad Ahmedabad Chennai Kolkata Home Features Mahindra XUV 3XO price, variants, features explained Mahindra XUV 3XO price, variants, features explained The XUV 3XO recently added new RevX variants, which are offered with two turbo-petrol engine options. Published On Jul 10, 2025 04:21:00 PM 1,06,165 Views Follow us on By Saptarshi Mondal Share - The Mahindra XUV 3XO , formerly XUV300, was launched last year with all-new front and rear designs, a refreshed interior and more features, as well as new powertrain options. Currently priced from Rs 7.99 lakh to Rs 15.79 lakh, ex-showroom India, this Mahindra SUV is available in a total of 12 trim levels (see table below). In this feature, we take a closer look at what features and engine options you get with each trim. Mahindra XUV 3XO petrol variant prices (in Rs, lakh) Petrol-MT Petrol-AT Diesel-MT Diesel-AMT MX1 7.99 - - - RevX M 8.94 - - - RevX M(O) 9.44 - - - MX2 - - 9.99 - MX2 Pro 9.54 10.54 10.64 - MX3 9.74 11.40 10.99 11.79 MX3 Pro 9.99 11.69 11.56 - AX5 11.19 12.69 12.19 12.99 RevX A T-GDI 11.79 12.99 - - AX5L T-GDI 12.62 13.94 - - AX7 T-GDI 12.80 13.99 13.69 14.70 AX7L T-GDI 13.99 15.80 14.99 - Mahindra XUV 3XO variant-wise powertrains The XUV 3XO's engine options include a 111hp, 200Nm, 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine, 131hp, 230Nm, 1.2-litre TGDI engine and 117hp, 300Nm, and 1.5-litre diesel engine.A 6-speed manual gearbox is standard with these engines.Also, both petrol engines get a 6-speed torque converter automatic gearbox, while the diesel XUV 3XO models come with a 6-speed AMT unit. The 111hp turbo-petrol engine is available on the MX1, RevX M, RevX M(O), MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, MX3 Pro and the AX5 trims. Moving on, the 131hp turbo-petrol engine is available only on the top four trims - RevX A, AX5 L, AX7 and AX7 L. The diesel engine is available nearly across the board, starting from the fourth-from-base MX2 trim. Here's a look at the variant split of the new XUV 3XO. Mahindra XUV 3XO Features Explained: A Comprehensive Guide. Published on 27 Aug, 2024, 9:41 AM IST Updated on 28 Aug, 2024, 5:59 AM IST Team Ackodrive 8 min read Interesting Articles Follow us on Share Post Mahindra recently launched the much-awaited Mahindra XUV 3XO as a compact SUV in the Indian automotive industry. Outperforming its rivals, the Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue and Maruti Suzuki Brezza, the Mahindra XUV 3XO brings a fresh look to the segment. With the latest updates and comfortable features, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is on the list of must-buy compact SUVs in India. Here, we will take a closer look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained and help you choose the ideal car. Contents Price of Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants After the Mahindra XUV 3XO features are explained, you must know the price of each variant. Hence, we have prepared a table for you highlighting the ex-showroom price of each XUV 3XO variant: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variant Ex-Showroom Price MX1 Rs. 7.49 Lakhs MX2 Rs. 9.99 Lakhs MX2 PRO Rs. 8.99 Lakhs to Rs. 10.39 Lakhs MX3 Rs. 9.49 Lakhs to Rs. 11.68 Lakhs MX3 PRO Rs. 9.99 Lakhs to Rs. 11.49 Lakhs AX5 Rs. 10.69 Lakhs to Rs. 12.88 Lakhs AX5 Luxury Rs. 11.99 Lakhs to Rs. 13.49 Lakhs AX7 Rs. 12.49 Lakhs to Rs. 14.49 Lakhs AX7 Luxury Rs. 13.99 Lakhs to Rs. 15.49 Lakhs Note : The prices of the Mahindra XUV 3XO variants can change without any prior notice. So, before booking your car, talk with your nearest dealer to know the latest price. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants Unlatch Elated Driving Experience with the All New Mahindra XUV 3XO Making its presence felt in the Indian compact SUV market, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is one of the best cars in this segment manufactured by Mahindra. It offers more convenience and comfort when driving on different terrains. The following are detailed discussions of the Mahindra XUV 3XO tech specs and features: 1. Influencing Exterior Look The Mahindra XUV 3XO has a specific design to turn heads with its athletic stance. It commands respect and exudes the confidence of a true SUV. The all-new Mahindra XUV 3XO has an ample ground clearance of 201 mm, making it easy for you to drive on rocky terrains. In addition, the XUV 3XO comes with a command seating position to offer an exhilarating driving experience. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has LED DRLs and headlamps that will lead the road to envy you whenever you turn them on. Furthermore, the infinity tail lamps add an X factor to your style quotient. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels for that sporty look. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Dimensions 2. Comforting Interior When you drive the Mahindra XUV 3XO, it elevates your every journey. Stepping inside the XUV 3XOs cabin will let you discover a sanctuary of sophistication and comfort. It is one of the key parts of the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained, as it has a meticulous design for the finest SUV lovers. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a Skyroof and soft-touch leatherette on the door trims and dashboard. Furthermore, the car has premium leatherette seats, a cooled glovebox with illumination, and a passive keyless entry. It also features a front armrest with storage and a console with a cup holder for a comfortable drive. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Interior 3. Smart Connectivity Another key Mahindra XUV 3XO configuration is its smart connectivity and technology. The car comes with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system to make your drive enjoyable. In addition, the sound system lets you experience sonic expanse, and the bass enhancer technology uplifts your mood while driving in crowded areas. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation and has built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment. Team Spinny Last updated 3 months ago As we all know the safety of a vehicle is one of the most important attributes in current times. People want a car that not only delivers on performance and efficiency but also stands out with its safety features. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is making headlines as one of the safest small SUVs in India. This beast by Mahindra has gained attention for its advanced features and design, which are further complemented with its safety features. It is an upgraded version of the Mahindra XUV300 that packs a strong punch. The starting price of the Mahindra XUV 3XO is Rs. 7.99 lakh (ex-showroom), making it an affordable yet well-equipped compact SUV. The safety of a vehicle is best measured through crash test ratings, and Mahindra has ensured that the XUV 3XO meets high standards. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating proves that it is one of the safest cars in its segment. Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP Safety Rating Checking a cars NCAP rating is one of the best ways to understand how safe it is. NCAP, or the New Car Assessment Program, conducts crash tests to see how well a vehicle can protect its occupants in an accident. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has performed well in its NCAP tests. It was tested under Bharat NCAP (BNCAP), which is Indias version of the global safety program. The Mahindra XUV 3XO received a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP, meaning it provides excellent protection for both adults and children. Lets look at the details of the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP rating. Mahindra XUV 3XO Adult Occupant Protection Rating During the adult occupants rating in the NCAP test, the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP ratings were pretty impressive. The vehicle scored the maximum possible score of 29.36 out of 32 points . Some crucial factors that contributed to this high rating include: Stable Bodyshell: The structure of the Mahindra XUV 3XO has been found to be stable, meaning it can withstand additional impact without collapsing. Frontal Impact Protection: The cars front airbags and seatbelt pre-tensioners helped reduce injuries to the head, neck, and chest. Side Impact Protection: The side structure of the XUV 3XO, along with additional side and curtain airbags, ensured safety in side collisions. Electronic Stability Control (ESC): This system helps maintain control of the car during sudden turns or slippery conditions, reducing the chances of rollovers. All-Wheel Disc Brakes: The XUV 3XO offers disc brakes on all four wheels, providing better braking efficiency. Mahindra XUV 3XO Child Occupant Protection Rating Child safety is another critical aspect of a cars overall safety rating. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating for child occupants is 43 out of 49 points , which is an excellent score. This means the car provides solid protection for children in case of an accident. Some of the key factors that contributed to this rating include: ISOFIX Child Seat Anchors: These allow parents to securely install child safety seats, reducing the risk of movement in case of impact. Dual-tone exterior colours are standard. 5 exterior colour options available. 16-inch black alloys of REVX A; RevX M variants get 16-inch steel wheels with black covers. RevX badge seen on C-pillar. RevX A gets the 131hp engine and an automatic gearbox option. RevX variants' interior layout the same as standard XUV 3XO. RevX M gets driver's seat height adjust over the MX2 Pro. Black leatherette seats standard on all RevX variants. RevX M gets 4-speaers; REVX A gets 6 speakers. 10.25-inch infotainment touchscreen standard on RevX variants. cabin featuring a segment-first panoramic sunroof Mahindra has launched the awaited XUV 3XO , basically the facelifted XUV300, at Rs 7.49 lakh (ex-showroom). The subcompact SUV sports a new modern design, an upgraded cabin which is similar to that of the XUV400 EV, plentiful new features and even mechanical updates. In this report, we are going to take you through the gallery of the XUV 3XO showcasing the design, interior, features and its specifications: Design The Mahindra 3XO gets a revamped design for the exterior, with a new fascia featuring a new bumper and a gloss black grille with chrome slats replacing the slatted one found in the XUX300. Flanking the grille, is a new pair of redesigned LED headlights, which adds to the overall modern appearance of the XUV 3XO. It now gets 17-inch dual-tone alloy wheels and apart from that, there are no other sheet metal changes here. You get to choose from 8 colour options: white, red, orange, beige, black, grey, green and yellow. Coming to the rear, it gets a new tailgate with connected LED taillights making it the first Mahindra to get a connected setup. Placed right below the taillights is the new XUV 3XO badge. It also gets a silver skid plate adding a bit of contrast and the number plate housing is in the bumper. With the new elements and styling, the subcompact SUV looks modern with a dash of ruggedness. Interior And Features Step inside and you will notice a new dashboard layout and cabin design, similar to that of the XUV4OO EV. The first thing you will notice is the 10.25-inch floating touchscreen infotainment system, below which are the AC vents located right above the chunky looking controls for the dual-zone climate control. It retains the same steering wheel which the pre-facelift XUV300 got, but with gloss-black inserts instead of the silver finish. Further enhancing the cabins feel is a segment-first panoramic sunroof which adds to the SUVs value proposition. The upgraded cabin gets a host of new features which make the SUV more desirable than before. The features include a 10.25-inch infotainment screen with wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay, 7-speaker Harman/Kardon sound system, connected car tech, 10.25-inch drivers display, dual-zone climate control, keyless entry, push-button start/stop, and wireless phone charging. Safety will be taken care of by Level-2 ADAS (first in its segment), 6 airbags, ABS, EBD, 360-degree camera, electronic stability control, 3-point seatbelts with reminder for all occupants, and ISOFIX child seat mounts. Specifications The XUV 3XO gets the same engines carried over from the XUV300. The engine options include a 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine generating 110 PS, a 1.2-litre T-GDI turbo-petrol engine producing 130 PS, and a 1.5-litre diesel engine making 117 PS. You get an option to pair these engines with either a manual or an automatic gearbox. The manual will be a 6-speed unit, while the automatic option will be a 6-speed torque converter for the petrol variants and an 6-speed AMT gearbox for the diesel variants. Price and rivals The XUV 3XO is priced from Rs 7.49 lakh to Rs 15.49 lakh (ex-showroom). With the introduction of the new XUV 3XO , Mahindra will look to give a tougher fight to the likes of Hyundai Venue , Kia Sonet , Tata Nexon and Maruti Suzuki Brezza . As the latest addition to Mahindras popular XUV range, the XUV 3XO combines style, comfort, performance, safety, and technology. In this detailed blog post, we will explore the key exterior and interior design elements of the XUV 3XO and how Mahindra has crafted an SUV that makes a strong visual impact. An Exterior that Demands Attention One look at the new XUV 3XO is all it takes to notice how dramatically styled this SUV is. The front, sides and rear reflect a sense of dynamism that appeals to young and young-at-heart buyers. Some of the standout exterior highlights include: A Bold & Distinctive Face The XUV 3XOs front fascia features a wide, imposing grille with distinct chrome inserts and the signature Mahindra twin peaks logo. This immediately gives it a bold SUV character. The grille seamlessly integrates with the slim headlamps that extend towards the wheel arches, giving a frowning look. The eye-shaped bi-LED projector headlamps with integrated LED daytime running lamps are added to the dramatic front styling. With chrome bezels, these headlamps have a high-tech look and also deliver powerful illumination. Further amping up the visual drama are niceties like the skid plate with silver accents dominating the lower bumper. The round fog lamps integrated into the skid plate amplify the front presence. Sculpted Profile Exuding Power In profile, the XUV 3XO maintains a muscular and athletic form. The flared wheel arches with cladding grab attention, while the pronounced shoulder line adds to the sculpted appeal. The 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels fill up the arches well, while the raised stance lends the XUV 3XO a towering road presence. Body-coloured ORVMs blend neatly into the design. Customers can also opt for a contrast roof and ORVM colours for a bi-tone effect. The window line rises dynamically towards the rear, while the rear haunch is well-defined. Subtle creases on the lower portion of doors make the silhouette more intriguing. Sleek & Modern Rear Profile The rear of the XUV 3XO continues to surprise with its contemporary design. It features a pair of LED tail lamps that extend onto the tailgate and have a three-dimensional effect. These graphic-rich tail lamps also incorporate neat LED turn signals. The tailgate has clean surfacing, while the chrome applique and model badging add premium touches. Adding some muscle are the dual exhaust pipes integrated into the black rear skid plate. The roof-mounted spoiler with an integrated high-mount stop lamp rounds off the rear nicely. A Cabin Exuding Warmth & Luxury Stepping inside the XUV 3XO gives you the same feeling as entering a plush lounge. The cabin prioritises comfort without compromising on the premium quotient. Some talking points of the well-appointed interior include: Premium Styling & Materials The XUV 3XO greets occupants with a classy dual-tone cabin featuring a black & beige colour theme. Premium leatherette door trims with stitching details instantly catch the eye. The leatherette seats come in the same colour scheme, feel supple, and provide snug support. Ambient lighting elevates the cabins sense of occasion, especially for night travel. Ergonomic & Functional Layout Despite modern styling and premium materials, the XUV 3XO retains Mahindras focus on practicality & ease of use. Controls fall easily at hand, while the uncluttered centre console offers storage solutions like a cooled glove box. The infotainment system with Apple CarPlay & Android Auto is in prime position. performance_metrics.text: [{'url': 'https://www.overdrive.in/news-cars-auto/mahindra-xuv-3xo-tgdi-at-real-world-mileage-and-performance-figures-revealed/', 'content': "Mahindra XUV 3XO TGDI AT real world mileage and performance figures revealed - Overdrive CARS Find Cars Compare Cars Car Reviews Car Photos Car Videos Car Brands Just Launched Cars Upcoming Cars Popular Cars Bikes Find Bikes Compare Bikes Bike Reviews Bike Photos Bike Videos Bike Brands Just Launched Bikes Upcoming Bikes Popular Bikes Reviews All Reviews Car Reviews Bike Reviews First Drive Road Test Comparo News & Features News Features Opinions Motorsport Press Releases photos All Photos Car Photos Bike Photos Videos compare Compare Cars Compare Bikes SUBSCRIBE | APP get app Subscribe Trending: Jeep Compass 4x2 AT Tata Nexon EV Citroen C3 Aircross TVS Apache RTR 310 RE Bullet 350 Honda CB200X Follow us Cars Bikes news reviews compare Advertisement Type vehicle name.. go Home News Mahindra XUV 3XO TGDI AT real world mileage and performance figures revealed Gajanan Kashikar Updated: May 10, 2024, 05:37 PM IST Mahindra recently launched the new XUV 3XO with prices starting from Rs 7.49 lakh (ex-showroom). It is available in a range of variants, namely MX1 Pro, MX2 Pro, MX3, AX5, AX5L, AX7, and AX7L. We recently tested the updated XUV 3XO to get the real-world performance and mileage figures, read on to find out the details. Mahindra XUV 3XO: Powertrain While the XUV 3XO carries over the same 110PS/200Nm 1.2-litre turbo-petrol, a 130PS/230Nm 1.2-litre T-GDI turbo-petrol, and a 117PS/300Nm 1.5-litre diesel engine, there is a new six-speed torque converter automatic transmission on offer alongside a six-speed manual and a six-speed AMT. In our performance test, the 1.2-litre TGDI petrol with six-speed automatic transmission returned a mileage of 12.49kmpl in the city and 14.87kmpl on the highway. In contrast, the overall ARAI fuel economy of this powertrain stands at 18.20kmpl. Further, the 1.2-litre turbocharged petrol paired with the six-speed torque convertor enabled the XUV 3XO to achieve zero to 100kmph in 10.7 seconds. In terms of in-gear acceleration, the SUV was able to reach from 30kmph to 50kmph in 2.0 seconds, 50kmph to 70kmph in 2.3 seconds, and 60kmph to 80kmph in 2.8 seconds. In addition, a braking test was conducted, revealing that the XUV 3XO required 3.7 seconds to come to a complete stop from a speed of 100kmph, covering a distance of 46m. Performance, and Safety  | Cargraze Home Cars Car Blog Tools Loan EMI Calculator Mileage Calculator Sell Used Car Check RC Login/ Register Home Car Info 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO: Specs, Design, Performance, and Safety 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO: Specs, Design, Performance, and Safety Published On Dec 24, 2024 By Cargraze for Car Info A Comprehensive Review of the Mahindra XUV 3XO in 2025: Features, Performance, and Value Are you looking for a compact yet powerful vehicle that combines performance, safety, and value in one stunning package? The Mahindra XUV 3XO might be the car youre searching for! Lets dive into a detailed review to see what this model brings in 2025. Design and Exterior Highlights One look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO, especially in black, and its clear that this car is a head-turner. Its sporty design elements stand out with: Chrome Accents: The grille and headlamp finish feature stylish chrome highlights. Projector Headlamps with LED DRLs: These enhance visibility and aesthetics. Diamond-Cut Alloy Wheels: The 16-inch alloys add a premium feel to the vehicle. Safety Ratings: With six airbags and a five-star Global NCAP safety rating, this vehicle excels in safety. Roof Rails & Spoilers: Gloss-black roof rails and a sleek spoiler give it a bold presence on the road. Although the car lacks front parking sensors and certain accessories come as add-ons, its robust styling and road presence more than makes up for these minor drawbacks. Interior Comfort and Technology Step inside the Mahindra XUV 3XO, and youll be greeted by a modern and comfortable cabin: Dual-Tone Dashboard: Soft-touch materials on the doors and satin finishes on the levers add a premium touch. Advanced Infotainment System: A 10.25-inch infotainment display paired with a 10.25-inch digital instrument cluster ensures seamless access to information and entertainment. Steering Controls: A three-spoke leather-wrapped steering wheel includes controls for cruise and infotainment systems. Comfort Features: From automatic climate control with dual-zone functionality to wireless charging and a vanity mirror with illumination, convenience is a priority. While its disappointing that the glovebox isnt cooled or illuminated, the XUV 3XO compensates with thoughtful features like rear AC vents, adjustable headrests, and ample storage options. Performance and Engine Specifications Under the hood, the Mahindra XUV 3XO packs a punch with its turbocharged petrol engine: Engine Options: It comes with a 1.2-liter three-cylinder MPFI engine, delivering 109 BHP and 200 Nm of torque. Transmission: Choose between manual and automatic transmissions, depending on your driving preference. Fuel Efficiency: Mahindra claims an ARAI-certified mileage of 18.5 km/l, though real-world figures hover around 14-15 km/l. The cars ride quality, stability, and safety features like ABS with EBD, electronic stability control, and tyre pressure monitoring ensure a secure driving experience. Practicality and Storage With a 364-liter boot space, the XUV 3XO offers decent storage capacity. However, operating the boot can feel a bit cumbersome due to its electromagnetic button placement. The spare wheel, tool kit, and first-aid essentials are neatly arranged but require some effort to access. Final Thoughts The Mahindra XUV 3XO is an impressive contender in the compact SUV segment. While it has its minor quirks, the blend of safety, design, and performance makes it a strong value-for-money option in its price range. Would we recommend it? Absolutely! Add it to your shortlist and take it for a spin to see if its the perfect fit for your needs. Dont forget to share your thoughts on this versatile vehicle in the comments section! Published On Apr 24, 2024 04:02:00 PM 79,590 Views Follow us on By Sahil Kukreja Share - Listen to this Article Your browser does not support the audio element. Mahindra has released yet another teaser of the XUV300 facelift to be called XUV 3XO just days ahead of its global debut. The new teaser video reveals its fuel efficiency figure as well as its 0-60kph sprint time. XUV 3XO diesel likely to deliver 20.1kpl XUV 3XO 1.2-litre TGDi likely to do 0-60kph in 4.5 seconds Launch on April 29 Also see: Mahindra XUV 3XO interior revealed in new teaser Mahindra XUV 3XO: performance, fuel efficiency As per the latest teaser, the XUV 3XO will be able to dash from 0-60kph in 4.5 seconds. However, well only be able to confirm the number once we get to drive it following the global debut. For reference, our Venue vs Sonet road test revealed that the 120hp 1.2-litre turbo-petrol-DCTversions of the two achieve the same feat in 5.30 seconds and 5.87 seconds respectively. Furthermore, the teaser confirms that the updated compact SUV will offer multiple drive modes, similar to the XUV700. While the larger SUV gets three drive modes namely Zip, Zap and Zoom the teaser suggests that the XUV 3XO could get the former two. Mahindra has also revealed that the XUV 3XO will offer an ARAI-certified fuel efficiency figure of 20.1kpl, however, the figure will likely be for the diesel powertrain, not the turbo-petrol engines. In comparison, the Tata Nexon diesel as a fuel efficiency of up to 24.07kpl , while the Kia Sonetdiesel with iMT is rated at 22.3kpl . That said, the XUV 3XO will continue with the same three engine options the 110hp, 1.2-litre turbo-petrol; the 131hp, 1.2-litre direct-injection turbo-petrol; and the 117hp, 1.5-litre diesel. The 131hp turbo-petrol engine will gain a new Aisin-sourced 6-speed torque converter automatic transmission. Mahindra XUV 3XO: feature upgrade, price, rivals The new XUV 3XO teaser reveals its fully-digital TFT instrument cluster in all its glory. The drivers display will measure 10.25-inches in size, while the car will also borrow the XUV400s 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system. Also on offer will be a first-in-class panoramic sunroof, which will possibly make it the most affordable SUV in India with this feature. Keeping in mind all the changes and the additional features , the XUV 3XO will be priced higher than the outgoing XUV300 . It will continue to take on the likes of Hyundai Venue , Tata Nexon , Kia Sonet , Maruti Brezza among other compact SUVs. Mahindra XUV 3XO Features Explained: A Comprehensive Guide. Published on 27 Aug, 2024, 9:41 AM IST Updated on 28 Aug, 2024, 5:59 AM IST Team Ackodrive 8 min read Interesting Articles Follow us on Share Post Mahindra recently launched the much-awaited Mahindra XUV 3XO as a compact SUV in the Indian automotive industry. Outperforming its rivals, the Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue and Maruti Suzuki Brezza, the Mahindra XUV 3XO brings a fresh look to the segment. With the latest updates and comfortable features, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is on the list of must-buy compact SUVs in India. Here, we will take a closer look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained and help you choose the ideal car. Contents Price of Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants After the Mahindra XUV 3XO features are explained, you must know the price of each variant. Hence, we have prepared a table for you highlighting the ex-showroom price of each XUV 3XO variant: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variant Ex-Showroom Price MX1 Rs. 7.49 Lakhs MX2 Rs. 9.99 Lakhs MX2 PRO Rs. 8.99 Lakhs to Rs. 10.39 Lakhs MX3 Rs. 9.49 Lakhs to Rs. 11.68 Lakhs MX3 PRO Rs. 9.99 Lakhs to Rs. 11.49 Lakhs AX5 Rs. 10.69 Lakhs to Rs. 12.88 Lakhs AX5 Luxury Rs. 11.99 Lakhs to Rs. 13.49 Lakhs AX7 Rs. 12.49 Lakhs to Rs. 14.49 Lakhs AX7 Luxury Rs. 13.99 Lakhs to Rs. 15.49 Lakhs Note : The prices of the Mahindra XUV 3XO variants can change without any prior notice. So, before booking your car, talk with your nearest dealer to know the latest price. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants Unlatch Elated Driving Experience with the All New Mahindra XUV 3XO Making its presence felt in the Indian compact SUV market, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is one of the best cars in this segment manufactured by Mahindra. It offers more convenience and comfort when driving on different terrains. The following are detailed discussions of the Mahindra XUV 3XO tech specs and features: 1. Influencing Exterior Look The Mahindra XUV 3XO has a specific design to turn heads with its athletic stance. It commands respect and exudes the confidence of a true SUV. The all-new Mahindra XUV 3XO has an ample ground clearance of 201 mm, making it easy for you to drive on rocky terrains. In addition, the XUV 3XO comes with a command seating position to offer an exhilarating driving experience. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has LED DRLs and headlamps that will lead the road to envy you whenever you turn them on. Furthermore, the infinity tail lamps add an X factor to your style quotient. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels for that sporty look. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Dimensions 2. Comforting Interior When you drive the Mahindra XUV 3XO, it elevates your every journey. Stepping inside the XUV 3XOs cabin will let you discover a sanctuary of sophistication and comfort. It is one of the key parts of the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained, as it has a meticulous design for the finest SUV lovers. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a Skyroof and soft-touch leatherette on the door trims and dashboard. Furthermore, the car has premium leatherette seats, a cooled glovebox with illumination, and a passive keyless entry. It also features a front armrest with storage and a console with a cup holder for a comfortable drive. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Interior 3. Smart Connectivity Another key Mahindra XUV 3XO configuration is its smart connectivity and technology. The car comes with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system to make your drive enjoyable. In addition, the sound system lets you experience sonic expanse, and the bass enhancer technology uplifts your mood while driving in crowded areas. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation and has built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment. Dimensions, Configurations, Features, Engine cc All New Used Ad English Login / Register NEW CARS Explore New Cars Electric Cars Mahindra BE 6 Mahindra XEV 9e Tata Harrier EV MG Windsor EV Tesla Model Y Tata Nexon EV All Electric Cars Popular Cars Hyundai Creta Defender Mahindra XUV 3XO Mahindra Thar ROXX Mahindra Scorpio Tata Nexon All Popular Cars Upcoming Cars New Launches Car Insurance Ad Popular Brands Maruti Cars Tata Cars Kia Cars Toyota Cars Hyundai Cars Mahindra Cars Compare Cars New Car Offers & Discounts Find Car Dealers Find EV Charging Stations Find Fuel Stations Check Fuel Prices Used cars Buy Used Cars Used Cars In Your City Ahmedabad Bangalore Chennai Delhi NCR Hyderabad Jaipur Kolkata Mumbai Pune More Cities Sell My Car Used Car Valuation Dealership Near Me News & Reviews News & Top stories Car Expert Reviews User Reviews Car Collection Tips & Advice Videos Video Reviews Visual Stories Select City Ad XUV 3XO Price Compare Offers Images Specs User Reviews 360 View Variants More Videos Mileage Colours XUV 3XO News FAQs Dealers Service Center Brochure XUV 3XO EMI Loan Second Hand XUV 3XO Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications The Mahindra XUV 3XO has 1 Diesel Engine and 1 Petrol Engine on offer. The Diesel engine is 1498 cc while the Petrol engine is 1197 cc . It is available with Manual & Automatic transmission.Depending upon the variant and fuel type the XUV 3XO has a mileage of 17.96 to 20.6 kmpl. The XUV 3XO is a 5 seater 3 cylinder car and has length of 3990 mm, width of 1821 mm and a wheelbase of 2600.
